com.ibm.team.repository.client

Interface IRetryPolicy


  • public interface IRetryPolicy
    A policy describing what failed requests can be retried and any limitations on the retry (example how many times they can be retried and if the client should back off to give the server a chance to recover before retrying).

    The policy also allows for pro-active logging in prior to initiating a set of service calls.

    Since:
    0.9.0.5 (RJF 4.0.5)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static IRetryPolicy DEFAULT
      Default retry policy is to not retry

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean autoReLogin()
      Should the call to a IClientLibraryContext.callCancelableService(com.ibm.team.repository.client.util.IClientLibraryContext.IServiceRunnable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor) result in an auto-login if the user is not currently logged in prior to performing the work.

      The maximum number of times a service method should be retried in the presence of a retryable failure

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT

        static final IRetryPolicy DEFAULT
        Default retry policy is to not retry

    • Method Detail

      • autoReLogin

        boolean autoReLogin()
        Should the call to a IClientLibraryContext.callCancelableService(com.ibm.team.repository.client.util.IClientLibraryContext.IServiceRunnable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor) result in an auto-login if the user is not currently logged in prior to performing the work. The team repository is expected to have been configured so that an auto-login can occur if enabled. This differs from ITeamRepository.setAutoLogin(boolean) which will automatically login at the start of a session the auto-login when enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the repository should be auto-logged in if not already logged in prior to the start of processing the work requested. false if the request should proceed regardless of the current login state.

      • getMaxRetries

        int getMaxRetries(java.lang.String serviceName,
                  java.lang.reflect.Method method)
        The maximum number of times a service method should be retried in the presence of a retryable failure
        Parameters:
        serviceName - The name of the service being called
        method - The method being called
        Returns:
        The number of times to retry. 0 if it should not be retried.

      • pauseBeforeRetry

        void pauseBeforeRetry(java.lang.String serviceName,
                      java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                      int retryNumber)
        A retry of a service call is about to be attempted. This method can inject a pause prior to the retry.
        Parameters:
        retryNumber - The number of the retry about to take place (1 for first retry, 2 for second, etc.)
        serviceName - The name of the service being called
        method - The method being called

      • isRetryable

        boolean isRetryable(java.lang.String serviceName,
                    java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                    java.lang.Throwable failure)
        Determines whether the failure that occurred is retryable or not.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - The name of the service being called
        method - The method being called
        failure - The failure that occurred
        Returns:
        true if the service call should be retried otherwise false to report the failure as per usual.
